info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Habersham, Rabun, southeastern Macon and northwestern Oconee Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Franklin to 10 miles north of Clarkesville. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Clayton, Highlands, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Tallulah Falls, Lake Burton and Tallulah Gorge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
